channel.title: PI source help
channel.description: I have changed the ip on my client but the IP on my source is still wrong , when i open the CMD box it starts my server on 0.0.0.0 and because of this, My friends cannot join my server. Can you get back to me ASAP :)

item.title: PI source help
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

eshay lad:

no-ip has nothing to do with runing a hamchi server lol

[quote=“eshay lad, post:4, topic:437241”]You can use it if u want.[/quote][quote=“eshay lad, post:2, topic:437241”]uhhh ehh do u know what port-forwarding means if yes have u don it.
Aswell if u have port-forward your client ip should be “127.0.0.1” port “43594” Source ip “127.0.0.1”
And u need a no-ip for the ip when u upload the client for your friends to connect up to or a vps.[/quote]
You’re fucking clueless.

Read full topic

item.title: PI source help
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“OwnerSquishy, post:1, topic:437241”]I have changed the ip on my client but the IP on my source is still wrong , when i open the CMD box it starts my server on
0.0.0.0 and because of this, My friends cannot join my server. Can you get back to me ASAP :)[/quote]

99% chance you are dealing with an anti-leech lol. If you’d have put any time into this source you’d have realized this.

Go get a source and client without anti-leech, i bet you could leech that one without any issues!

Read full topic

item.title: PI source help
item.dc:creator: @eshay_lad eshay lad
item.description:
@eshay_lad wrote:

no-ip has nothing to do with runing a hamchi server lol

Read full topic

item.title: PI source help
item.dc:creator: @Demon6994 Demon6994
item.description:
@Demon6994 wrote:

Honestly, I personally think if they can’t connect with 127.0.0.1, or the hamachi IP, I don’t think it’ll work. The no-ip is like local I guess, but it just mask your IP… Which you could try using I guess…

I dunno.

Read full topic

item.title: PI source help
item.dc:creator: @OwnerSquishy OwnerSquishy
item.description:
@OwnerSquishy wrote:

The client Ip is my hamachi ip though.

If I make my no-ip adress the client ip? would they still be able to connect through hamachi?

Read full topic

item.title: PI source help
item.dc:creator: @Demon6994 Demon6994
item.description:
@Demon6994 wrote:

The 0.0.0.0 means nothing… It’s just text placed there. If I wanted, I could make is say. ‘bananas are awesome’.
And I would still be able to connect.
Try setting the client to your hamachi IP…

Read full topic

item.title: PI source help
item.dc:creator: @OwnerSquishy OwnerSquishy
item.description:
@OwnerSquishy wrote:

My friends are connected to my Hamachi network, And it says “Error Connecting to server” when they try get onto the server!

Read full topic

item.title: PI source help
item.dc:creator: @Demon6994 Demon6994
item.description:
@Demon6994 wrote:

I had a PI server at one point. it always said 0.0.0.0 and it never ment a thing. It was just text. Your friends may not be connected to your Hamachi. Or they straight up fail.

Read full topic

item.title: PI source help
item.dc:creator: @OwnerSquishy OwnerSquishy
item.description:
@OwnerSquishy wrote:

I have heard we need to portforward, But idk how to portforward. Is anyone able to helo me with this?

I would rather use hamachi as I only wont selected people on my server. If anyone wants to show me how to put my hamachi or my no-ip address on my source, That would help me alot!

Read full topic

item.title: PI source help
item.dc:creator: @HandgunSally HandgunSally
item.description:
@HandgunSally wrote:

[quote=“eshay lad, post:2, topic:437241”]uhhh ehh do u know what port-forwarding means if yes have u don it.
Aswell if u have port-forward your client ip should be “127.0.0.1” port “43594” Source ip “127.0.0.1”
And u need a no-ip for the ip when u upload the client for your friends to connect up to or a vps.[/quote]
Server yo. not the client.
he needs to know where to change the Server side Ip address from 0.0.0.0 to his no-ip address. I am also having this issue. when we start our run.bat file it says listening to 0.0.0.0 and not our no-ip address.

Read full topic
